document_title: Sore throat: Causes, symptoms and prevention
subsection_content:
Diagnosis of the initial cause of a sore throat is usually made by an Ear, Nose and Throat doctor. Physical examination includes examining and observing the throat, palpating cervical lymph nodes, taking personal and family medical history, and checking whether the throat shows signs of inflammation or not.
Diagnostic methods that can be used to find the cause include:
Ear, nose and throat endoscopy: to diagnose diseases and screen for tumors in the ear, nose and throat area.; Gastroesophageal endoscopy: If there is evidence of sore throat due to gastric acid reflux; Tumor biopsy: If cervical lymph nodes are palpable and nasopharyngeal cancer or another type of head and neck cancer is suspected; Chest X-ray + AFB sputum: Culture for tuberculosis bacteria if pulmonary tuberculosis is suspected.; Oropharyngeal secretion test: If sore throat is suspected due to Covid-19 infection.; Thyroid ultrasound: if there are signs of suspected thyroid disease.
